title: Godard title sequence typeface
content:
Any ideas? Note the dot above the cap 'i'!

[http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/godard.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122301/http:/www.morganstudio.co.uk/godard.jpg "http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/godard.jpg")
author: hungrymoon

comments.content: This looks to be the real deal. I mean it looks old. However, it resembles Gotham in many ways, except, of course, the dot over the cap-I.

_it resembles Gotham in many ways, except, of course, the dot over the cap-I_  
and the flat bottom vertex of M

You won't find a digital font with a cap I like that. As alternates, try [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122301/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=MSF.123353.0.41&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LES+ENFANTS&sampleSize=48), [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122301/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.125859.0.7&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LES+ENFANTS&sampleSize=48), [Avant Garde](http://web.archive.org/web/20130905122301/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.125976.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LES+ENFANTS&sampleSize=48).

_You won’t find a digital font with a cap I like that._

unless it includes support for turkish, and then it should have a dotted I of some kind.
